meanings.definition: A muscle of the upper back that connects the spine to the shoulder blades.
meanings.sent1: The rhomboids help you move your shoulders back.
meanings.sent2: During exercise, it's important to strengthen your rhomboids.
meanings.sent3: When the rhomboids get tired, they might feel like tiny knots in your upper back.
meanings.sent4: Her rhomboids were as strong as steel cables, supporting her posture effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The physical therapist demonstrated how to stretch the rhomboids for better flexibility.

meanings.definition: A geometric shape with all sides of equal length but no right angles.
meanings.sent1: The kite flying in the sky was shaped like a rhomboids.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler carefully cut the gemstone into a perfect rhomboids.
meanings.sent3: The rhomboids of the playing card made it stand out from the rest of the deck.
meanings.sent4: The building's roof had a unique design, resembling a cluster of rhomboids.
meanings.sent5: The artist used rhomboids in various sizes to create a captivating mosaic pattern.
